file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-21-04-02 - ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGE - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGE - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to replace/discard the cartridges of the engine fire extinguishing bottle. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ENGINE-FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE ALL 26-21-04-960-801-A ♦ CARTRIDGES - REPLACEMENT/ DISCARD EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 26-21-04 Page 1 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-21-04-960-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE-FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGES - REPLACEMENT/DISCARD A. General (1) To do the task, refer to the instructions in Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 26-21-02-000-801-A/400 ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE - REMOVAL ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 26-21-02-400-801-A/400 TION Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 312 312AR Tail cone compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Ladder To get access to the tail cone 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Tail cone compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the engine fire-extinguishing bottle (AMM TASK 26-21-02-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 26-21-04 Page 2 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Discard Engine Fire Extinguishing Bottle Cartridges SUBTASK 960-002-A WARNING: THE CARTRIDGES ARE EXPLOSIVE DEVICES. ACCIDENTAL DETONATION OF A CARTRIDGE CAN CAUSE INJURY. DURING THE TASK, OBEY ALL SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN THE PACIFIC SCIENTIFIC CMM. (1) Remove and discard the cartridges. Refer to the last revision of Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. (2) Install the new cartridges. Refer to the last revision of Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the engine fire-extinguishing bottle ( AMM TASK 26-21-02-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 26-21-04 Page 3 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
